paragraphs.text:
%md
Working a bit with sensor data in Cassandra.

Needs Cassandra to be up-and-running ... and for being useful, also the data pipeline must fill cassandra

> dcos package install cassandra

and Zeppelin Interpreter for Cassandra to point to a node using mesos

> cassandra.hosts: node-0.cassandra.mesos,node-1.cassandra.mesos,node-2.cassandra.mesos

paragraphs.title: Create a place to store key/value pairs (if it doesn't exists)
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra
CREATE KEYSPACE IF NOT EXISTS sensordata WITH replication = {'class': 'SimpleStrategy', 'replication_factor': 2 };
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS sensordata.sensorreading_by_device_sensortype(
    deviceid text, 
    sensortype text, 
    date text, 
    x double, 
    y double, 
    z double,
    PRIMARY KEY (deviceid, sensortype, date)
) WITH CLUSTERING ORDER BY (sensortype ASC, date DESC);

result.msg:
No Result

 gyro
Column Type Column Name Data Type
deviceid text
  date text
x double
y double
z double
As CQL statement 

CREATE TABLE sensordata.gyro (
    deviceid text,
    date text,
    x double,
    y double,
    z double,
    PRIMARY KEY (deviceid, date)
) WITH CLUSTERING ORDER BY (date DESC)
   AND read_repair_chance = 0.0
   AND dclocal_read_repair_chance = 0.1
   AND gc_grace_seconds = 864000
   AND bloom_filter_fp_chance = 0.01
   AND caching = { 'keys' : 'ALL', 'rows_per_partition' : 'NONE' }
   AND comment = ''
   AND compaction = { 'class' : 'org.apache.cassandra.db.compaction.SizeTieredCompactionStrategy', 'max_threshold' : 32, 'min_threshold' : 4 }
   AND compression = { 'chunk_length_in_kb' : 64, 'class' : 'org.apache.cassandra.io.compress.LZ4Compressor' }
   AND default_time_to_live = 0
   AND speculative_retry = '99PERCENTILE'
   AND min_index_interval = 128
   AND max_index_interval = 2048
   AND crc_check_chance = 1.0;

paragraphs.title: Show the 10 most recent measurements of one iPhone
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra
SELECT * FROM accelerometer WHERE deviceid = '9EF6C34F-FA17-4910-8AC0-B8E6DA29A2D7_iPhone OS' LIMIT 10;

paragraphs.title: Show maximum date of all other phones. Why? Because that can be an indication of progress of messages...
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra
SELECT MAX(date) FROM gyro WHERE deviceid IN ('9EF6C34F-FA17-4910-8AC0-B8E6DA29A2D7iPhone OS', '748790E7-1639-44C7-9D6C-423BCA5D611D_iPhone OS',
'72ED0416-739D-49DD-92CC-CC442A6E6C0B_iPhone OS', '6EC09F7D-9479-4C1F-90D4-1B95546802D3_iPhone OS', '4DF5779D-2B39-469B-928C-B6DBA7849E25_iPhone OS',
'4085211A-AEE5-48B8-B8E6-A96A5BD47D8F_iPhone OS', '0C09B0A6-87DA-4CC4-A553-5C53A0B60914_iPhone OS');

paragraphs.title: If it didn't exist, zero results should get returned. Otherwise there might be some leftovers...
Inserting some test numbers - with deviceid testfile to easily identify
